name: Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: We recently spent 3 nights at this hotel. We were wary, since it wasn't a beachfront hotel, and we have had bad experiences with Puerto Rico hotels before (El Conquistador, in particular).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were thoroughly delighted with the hotel, the staff, the amenities, etc. The staff went out of their way to make sure that our stay was pleasant. The hotel is a typical Embassy Suites, with a 2 room suite setup (living area and bedroom). The free buffet breakfast was substantial (hot and cold foods), free happy hour each night (a variety of wine, beer, liquor), free wireless internet throughout the hotel areas (including pool), free business services (fax, internet, etc). They even have a kiosk in the lobby to print out your boarding passes.
reviews.title: Staff
We loved Embassy Suites San Juan
reviews.text: The hotel is an easy 5 minute walk to the beach.

reviews.title: Embassy Suites A Great Deal
reviews.text: All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in San Juan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff really needs to be reconsidered. While I was staying at the Embassy Suites, I had all sort of trouble and they either kept me ignored or came up with a temporary solution until I left. That is not the way to treat a guest.
reviews.title: ghost?

reviews.text: We stayed an extra 2 nights in San Juan after our Carnival Valor cruise returned to port and had reserved 1 room at the Embassy Suites San Juan. The ship docked at 7 am so we arrived at the hotel early knowing that we couldn't check in and so they allowed us to store our luggage there which was a great perk as we wanted to go explore Old San Juan. They allowed me to Pre- check in which also nice because when we returned to the hotel later that day the line to check in was ridiculously long. Still, we didn't have our keys so had to ask the bell hop and went in the back and got our keys for us and our luggage.
reviews.title: Spend San Juan vacation elsewhere.

reviews.text: Here is where things start going downhill. When we arrived at our room it literally took 25-30 swipes of the room key for the door to open. When we opened the door it looked like a typical sterile Embassy Suites room. The furniture was in good repair but the carpet was frayed in several places. The bathroom had extra caulk in shower like covering up something? Neither lamp worked in the living room. When we attempted to change the TV channels, it would go above channel # 10 yet on their book on the coffee table the channels go up through 38. My son wanted the sofa bed and there were no sheets or pillow in the room. When I closed the bathroom door and the proceeded to open it the handle came off in my hand. Thank goodness I was able to use the AT&T wifi (don't really know where that was coming from) because I never could sign into the hotel wifi on any of our 5 devices. Also, there were 3 sets of towels in a room with two beds and a sofa bed?? Never did understand that.
reviews.title: Good quality, friendly, nice location and service

reviews.text: I wrote out a list of items that we needed and things that needed maintenance attention and took to the front desk on our way to dinner around 7 pm. The girl was nice and listened to my wants and needs. I do have to say that the staff was pleasant while we were there. When we returned from dinner nothing had been done. By that time it was after 10:30 pm. Just then housekeeping knocked on the door and brought the sheets and towels. We went to bed.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day we were more rested so I looked into he lamp situation and discovered the plastic knob was missing on one lamp and the other had a on/ off switch on the lamp cord. So 1/2 my fault on the lamp situation but had to get the plastic knob off the bedroom lamp to turn on the living room lamp. We reported the maintenance issues again early that afternoon and left for the day. When we returned still nothing. Later that day I could not enter my room again and went down and reported everything a third time. A bellhop accompanied me up to the room and he had a difficult time with the door lock also and reported it to someone on his radio and told me the lock was old and worn out and needed to be replaced. I don't speak Spanish, so I don't know who he reported it to.
reviews.title: Embassy Suites Very slow Check In

reviews.text: We check out the next morning and again , 4th time, reported the issues and with barely an apology the front desk girl refunded 1 nights stay.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here in February 2013.
reviews.title: Fun time!

reviews.text: Location was great, close by the airport. We enjoyed waking up to a hot breakfast buffet every morning which was included in our stay as well as a "happy hour" nightly that included free drinks!
reviews.title: Not a destination hotel

reviews.text: No complaints on our end, we enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: so so place

reviews.text: Stayed here two nights after a week in Rio Grande with three kids. Pretty rough around the edges for the brand and as a whole.
reviews.title: Good Vacation

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Average
I'd stay there again
reviews.text: A friend and I stayed here October 27 to 29. It is an excellent hotel. The atrium is very impressive. The elevator design is geometric/industrial rather than opulent, but they are good elevators with glass wall views as one ascends to the rooms. The suites had aging, slightly dowdy furnishings, but the rooms were quite comfortable and spacious. The shower-tub could use a clothesline, but that is a minor quibble. The happy hour is a pleasant plus with very good drinks. The breakfast is also very good. My friend, Dick, enjoyed the casino and found the rules for blackjack highly favorable in part because of the ability to surrender. He was up $100+ after two nights.
The wonderful pool is by a freeway, but it is largely screened by dense palms and the waterfall provides white noise to hush the traffic.
reviews.title: Eh, ok
okay hotel
reviews.text: The staff bends over backward to provide top-notch service. The fitness center is small, but adequate and a nice retreat.
It is a straight two block walk to the magnificent Isla Verde beach. It is a one block walk to reasonable shops and a variety of restaurants. The Carolina/Isla Verde area is a very nice area.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: We rented a car at the adjacent Holiday Inn (Less than $38 total plus $14.75 for gas). I found the other drivers to be laid back and cortez/simpatico. We drove all over the city and old San Juan. Dick could not walk much. We drove to El Yunque and as far up as we could go by car and thoroughly enjoyed the trip.
reviews.title: Breakfast & Manager's Reception!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was disgusting. Sticky spill/stain in the bedroom, mattress was horrible, dipped in the middle. Room seemed like it had not been cleaned. They didn't even give us soap for the shower, had to move soap from sink to shower. Attendant at the pool gave us dirty towels as they were "out" of clean towels. Embassy suites offers breakfast and happy hour complementary... don't bother. Lines for both are outrageous and food/drinks are horrible. Our mini fridge didn't work and needed to be replaced. Our in room phones were broken as well. Do not stay here if you have expectations of USA embassy suites. This place was under staffed, over populated and in horrible condition. We found another hotel. The staff apologized and moved us to a cleaner room with a decent bed, but we were so disgusted we moved hotels.
reviews.title: We checked out and moved hotels

reviews.text: We usually do well at the Embassy Suites since it provides our family of 5 with more room. We booked a 2BR 2Bath adjoining room and thought it was very spacious and the extra bathroom was a plus. The carpeting was in desperate need of replacing (stains, carpet wasn't tacked down, missing pieces, etc...). The hotel rooms were worn out. I would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Hotel needs a facelift

reviews.text: The room is very comfortable and spacious. This is very important if you have kids. The breakfast is excellent and is free. The afternoon snack is good and they have a lot of drinks and is free too!! The service was excellent and the outback inside of the hotel is very good choice to eat!!
reviews.title: Relax And very comfortable

reviews.text: Very good experience. Hotel has free happy hour drinks in the afternoon. It is very close to the airport. Hotel is clean and has the Outback Steak House inside the hotel. It has a nice pool area and gym. The staff, including maids were great. They also had a very nice free buffet breakfast with made to order eggs or omelet.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: This hotel is simply amazing. Nice pools. Good size cadino with live music. A very friendly and helpful staff. We were stuck in plaza Carolina due to heavy rains and after calling the hotel they went out their way to send us a taxi. The breakfast was really nice. There were lots of stuff to choose from. The free happy hour was great. The on site restaurant has the best cheeseburger I ever had. There is a 2mns walk to other restaurants and a bus stop. Very close to the airport. Loved this hotel. Would recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay last minute. Because of the "Emily Hurriccane" that was coming to the Island of Vieques. We chose it because of the "Free" Breakfast buffet & Mgr. Happy hour. The bonus was their was a grocery store right around the corner walking distance. Plus they have a fridge & microwave in room. The down side was room were very dated and old. Bathrooms were old looking but clean. Pool area was nice they offered a Toddler area, 2ft deep pool is great! They had starfish, sea horses, fish designs in the pool. Little patio furniture, play area with many slides. My daughter loved it!! Could use a bit more shade over there.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: We went to Puerto Rico on 07/24/2011 and stood at the Embassy Suites for 6 nights. The Hotel is beautiful, our suites were comfortable, the pool was nice.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, we loved it.....

reviews.text: Breakfast was great, i loved the oatmeal!
reviews.title: Nice pre-cruise stay

reviews.text: Our room cards kept deactivating for some reason, so that was a slight inconvenience and we rented a car, so we had to pay $17.12 a day for parking and that was expensive to me!
reviews.title: Went for work but after I played

reviews.text: The Hotel is located within walking distance of lots of other eateries and Walgreens.
reviews.title: Comfortable and quiet

reviews.text: My family stayed here on Jan 25, 2005. It's funny reading the previous reviews because we had a very different impression of the hotel. I found it to be clean, comfortable and quiet. Yes, there is maintenance being done, but the workers are very careful and warn you if you are approaching a freshly painted area.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel Stay
Nice hotel, great service, bad location.
reviews.text: The beds are fine, the sofa bed is a bit uncomfortable and for one night was acceptable.
The breakfasts were fine. Great coffee. The nightly manager party was fun with fruity drinks, and standard junk food of chips, pretzels, party mix and popcorn.
reviews.title: Under construction! Wait until done! or try Hampton Inn

reviews.text: The pool was lovely, I can't figure out what people were complaining about. I didn't see any missing tiles and I made a point of searching it out. One traveler said the pool area looked like a hurricane hit it. I can't figure that out either it was simply beautiful.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: Yes, you can hear the planes either taking off or landing depending on the direction of the wind. After awhile you get use to the sound and you don't notice the aircraft noise. The sounds of the kids screaming and yelling drown the noise out. I don't mind the sound of the kids, I simply put on my headphones and listen to music. It's not as bad as previous reviews write and I consider myself very sensitive to unnecessary noise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Overall satisfied
reviews.text: I stayed at the Embassy suites with my family. I was overall satisfied with our stay there. The staff was very helpful and the room was kept clean. Initially I was put off by the fact that our room had lots of ANTS. The staff was quick to move us to a different suite when we complained about the infestation. So I wasn't a happy camper when we first arrived. I also couldn't believe that a suite which would sleep 4 of us only had 4 drawers and a tiny closet. The drawers were small. But you know what? by the evening of our first day there we forgot all about that other stuff and enjoyed the managers reception-which is free drinks and snacks. The hotel is also conveniently located off the main road which has many souvenir shops,restaurants and a small supermarket. The best place to get puerto rican food inexpensively is La Casita which is in the shopping center near the hotel. I've also stayed at the Intercontinental hotel in the past. These two hotels are 2 that I would recomment. The advantage the Intercontinental Hotel has is that it is right on the beach. The beach is about 2 blocks from the Embassy Suites and easily accessible off the main road . Again overall I was a satisfied guest.

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: I went to PR for the first time this summer and the Embassy Suites was a great selection. I traveled with seven other females and we all loved the hotel. The staff was great, the free breakfast (made to order) was a great addition to the manager's reception (free drinks) every evening from 5-7pm.

The hotel is located very close (1 to 2 blocks) to all hotels/ clubs, and the beach is about 2 blocks away. Embassy suites also has a beautiful pool and jacuzzi area, not to mention some handsome pool men:) I plan to return next year with my girls again.
reviews.title: It's a place for everyone, singles, families!

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed at the Embassy from Aug 12th-17th. This hotel is great for the price! Complimentary breakfast and drinks in the evening daily. What more can you ask for? :) It's clean and the pool is well maintained. The only problem we had, we felt that a few of the employees at the front desk can be a little short and should be more pleasant. However, how much time do you spend at the front desk. I would recommend this place to friends.
reviews.title: Loved the Embassy Suites

reviews.text: Embassy suites was a good election. Very clean. Lovely pool and very near a nice beach. I highly recommend
reviews.title: great get away
very satisfied
reviews.text: Just returned from a girls' trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed for 5 nights at the Embassy Suites, as many other hotels are in renovation. With four women, it was a wise choice! The hotel is centrally located for the beach and activities of Isla Verde. Parking costs $10 a day, which is economical for the area. Cabs are also readily available for all of the sites. We were checked in early, despite arriving over an hour before official check-in time, to a good sized room. The room was very clean and serviced well each day, including special requests. We did find one roach during the stay. The front desk staff and bar staff were very friendly. The hotel has a great pool, which has music on the weekends. Unfortunately, the cocktail and food service at the pool is a bit irregular and ends at 3pm, which is disappointing. The free happy hour, standard with Embassy Suites, was quite a draw, and we had to wait in a long line for drinks. Thankfully, they were more than accomdating for two drinks when we reached the front of the line! ;-) The free breakfast is too early for vacation travelers, but we did manage to hit it one day and were very satisfied. For a smaller group, I may stay somewhere else, but with a large group, I would definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convinietly located near the airport and in a nice area. Lots of restaurants close by. It is about 5 minute walk from the beach too. The staff were all courtious and helpful. Room was very clean although it needed a fresh coat of paint.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was excellent and convinient. We enjoyed having Outback restaurant in the lobby too!
reviews.title: Loved the Embassy Suites and Staff

reviews.text: The pool area was nice with waterfalls etc. There was a gym and the hotel also had a coin laundry facility... very nice for people staying there longet than a few days...
reviews.title: Excellent Quality and friendly

likes.liked: — The large rooms and the friendly staff

reviews.text: We would definitely stay there again- a good value.
reviews.title: Great for short family stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't stay here; stayed next door at the Holiday Inn; but we walked over the Embassy to visit the casino and the Outback steakhouse. This hotel was very nice from what we experienced. The lobby is a lush garden and very inviting. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Check it out!
reviews.title: Very Nice
great trip
reviews.text: we were at the embassy suites in isla verde from march 8-11. The hotel its self was decent.. .nothing spectacular, but no problems. We paid 359 per night... for a suite which housed 5 people easily. There were two full sized beds in the bedroom and one pullout sofa in the living roon. The breakfast buffet is a must with eggs, bacon, sausage, and all the fixins. there is even an omlette bar where you pick your own ingredients. The hotel is very close to the airport, but i didn't here one plane go by, even though i can see the planes from my room window. The cost for taxi from the airport to the hotel should be 12 bucks... unless you have 4+ people. the cost to cab it to old san juan was 20 one way. The hotel pool was good... but there was no beach that it leads onto. The hotel is about 1.5 blocks from the beach..... so no direct access from the hotel. The hotel did have a casino which i didn't use much so i can't comment on it... but drinks are free if you play at the tables for some length of time. There was an outback steakhouse in the hotel which was good to see after a very disapointing outing at a local restaurant where i tried th Mofongo.... which believe me sounds a lot better than it is.

reviews.title: Rewarding experience
reviews.text: One thing that i recommend everyone to do before they leave is goto the rainforest and stop by the Bio Bay in Frajoda(sp). We went there on a boat with 16 in the group. When we first got there it wasn't much of a site.. until you get into the water....I'm not much of a swimmer, but i put on a life vest and ventured into the darkness ... the further away from the boat i got.. the more intense the glo was...it was one of the most AMAZING things that i have ever seen. Make sure you go there late at night... We didn't actually jump into the lake until about 11:00 pm. But it is a must for anyone coming to PR. They have other bio bay's around PR, but the one in Frajoda was the closest... and we were able to go there right after the rainforest. The water was said to have 4x the salt concentration as the ocean, so not much was living in the lake besides the glo organisms. A plus for you ladies... and men also is that your skin will be baby soft after you wash off the salt remains.
by the way .. the photos above are pretty good representations of the hotel
reviews.title: A nice enough hotel
Loved this place
reviews.text: We stayed four nights in early March 2007. This hotel delivers on what it advertises. Friendly check-in; attractive lobby area, very nice suites, outstanding service, a very generous breakfast and happy hour, a fine pool and spa, and a fun casino. Five minute ride from the airport, two blocks from the beaches. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Easy car rental nearby and convenient to the major highways. The Internet access was nice, too.

The rooms are dated but clean. The location is close to a great beach but also next to the airport. You can hear planes easily at the pool but I suspect this is true if all the resorts near here. Beach chairs and umbrellas provided. Good breakfast but get there early or you'll be waiting. Same thing with evening reception. They ask you to wear a wristband during your stay but this keeps out the moochers. Expect to pay 16 percent service fee. They will make you wait to checkin at 4pm which creates long delays during checkin as there may be a lot of people waiting. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: I went there looking for some great time with family. The only thing we really enjoyed was the breakfast. The service is average, so does the rooms. The hotel is very close to the airport so you should not pay too much in a cab. The cleanliness is average too. The have happy hours/open bar for the adults. The only thing kids will enjoy is the pool. So, the hotel is not that much.
reviews.title: Its a family hotel.

reviews.text: Location is ok. This is a very busy, crowded hotel! Not sure if we just stayed at a bad time but we were unimpressed...stood in line for 50 minutes to check in, lines for happy hour & breakfast were outrageous, carpet in room was damp, elevator to parking deck was broken so had to carry luggage up stairs, breakfast buffet was half empty & generally not good, unfriendly staff...definitely not what we usually experience at other Embassy Suite hotels. Average at best.
reviews.title: Not the best choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into this hotel after a great Carnival cruise, to do some sightseeing in Puerto Rico before flying home, as it was close to the airport.
reviews.title: Embassy Suites Isla Verde - air conditioning need repair/maintenance

reviews.text: There is a great little restaurant within a two block walk of the hotel - Mi Casita. Recommended by staff when we asked, and much better than the encroaching Burger King and other chain restaurants.
reviews.title: Renovations a must!!!!

reviews.text: My family of five stayed three days in San Juan after a week long cruise.. Hurricane Irene past just south of San Juan the first night and it rained lick crazy for the next two day. The staff did a great job keeping everyone comfortable. When talking to a few of the staff is was told that may of them where without power and water at home.
reviews.title: Best place to ride out a Cat. 1 Hurricane

reviews.text: The people were very accommodating. the staff were super helpful and informative. The rooms were excellent in space, amenities and decorations. I stayed 4 nights. However, the longer I stayed the customer services (room and maid) begain to decline. Overall, it was a good hotel, close to the airport and in a gotel area with good casinos and nice resturants.
reviews.title: Would return again

reviews.text: What a nice resort! We were pleasantly surprised as we had never been to Puerto Rico and didn't know what to expect. This resort was better than expected and the service was excellent. The "extras were awesome including the cook to order breakfast and buffett and the comp daily happy hour. The staff were great and catered to all of our needs. Good for family or business with a beautiful pristine pool and grounds. We would definitely come back again. I would recommend the Rocaliza Eco Adventure and going to Rincon to see some of the most beautiful Beaches in the world. This is a good value.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place to spend time and relax. beautiful pool area where you could enjoy a drink that is free from 5 to 7 EVERY day any drink or beer. walking distance to the beach where you could get chair an umbrella and towels courtesy of Embassy Suite dont take the one from the room. Enjoy is Excellent hotel on my book.
reviews.title: lovely place, friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: We returned from a cruise and stayed one night. We were allowed to check into one of our rooms early, 9 a.m. which made using the facilities much easier. The pool is large and the kids really enjoyed it, there were plenty of lounge chairs around deck of the pool. The only negative was the traffic noise on the highway overpass located near the pool but after a few minutes the kids noise overwhelmed the traffic noise anyway. The hotel was clean and attractive with a small casino, about twice the square footage of our cruise ship casino with more table games though. The full breakfast offered to guests was very enjoyable and if you are a Hilton Honors member you can even skip the long lines. The manager's reception in the afternoon was nice with tap beer, soda and mixed drinks but could have offered more than just popcorn and chips, maybe I'm just picky. The beach is a short two block walk away with an Embassy Suites concessionaire providing beach chairs and umbrellas for guests at the hotel, a very nice touch. Overall a nice but short stay, would have liked to stay longer. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, convienent access to beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while in Puerto Rico. We loved it. I wish we could have had more time here. The rooms were large and the beds comfy. The food in the hotel restaurant was very good. There were 2 free drinks per person every evening from 5-7, but beware that the lines are long and move slowly. We took ours back to our room. There were also some free snacks - popcorn and nachos. The lobby was beautiful. The pool looked wonderful, but we weren't there long enough to swim. We were on a trip from Mayaguez to Phili, and had to spend one night in San Juan as a layover. We really wished we had planned on being there longer so that we could enjoy the hotel. The casino looked small, but we weren't interested in that any way. The breakfast (free) in the morning was huge. We had an early flight, but luckily for us, we were able to grab something about 15 min before it officially opened. We did not have time to enjoy some of the breakfast items, like made to order omelets, but that was ok. It cost about $11 and $1 per bag (one way) to get there from the airport and cost about $20 one way to get to Old San Juan.
reviews.title: This is a really nice hotel

reviews.text: This was a great Hotel to stay at, the staff was friendly and very helpfull. the hotel is located an easy walking distance from the beach and they have a reserved area for hotel guests. the daily happy hour was a nice plus as well.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: 1. Decent rooms and beds.

reviews.text: 2. Clean Restrooms.
reviews.title: I liked it!

reviews.text: 3. Courteous Staff although housekeeping is a little slow.

Great Hotel!
reviews.text: I just returned from my honeymoon at the Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel. I loved it! The two room suite was beautiful, the free breakfast buffet was great, the free happy hour was excellent! The staff was friendly and always cleaning. It was in a great location, just a block from the beach and busline. They could book tours for you. I didn't want to leave!!!!

My son and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in mid December. We arrived very early in the morning and our room was waiting for us which we were thankful for since we had a long flight. The Embassy Suites is a great hotel for families, since they offer a free buffet breakfast. The rooms are nice and large, and our room was clean. TV worked ....all was ok The hotel does have a small casino for those who like to gamble. There is also a happy hour, and a nice resturant on site..Outback Steak House??I think??.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, But Not Near The Beach
Great Pre-Cruise Hotel
reviews.text: There are two computers for e-mail or internet service. At this hotel, I think the only draw back for me is that the hotel is a little to far from the ocean. You have to walk several blocks to get to the main street which is Isa Verde. I think parking at the hotel is $16.00 per day. When we were there, we had to walk over to the InterContinental Hotel which is a beautiful hotel on the beach to pick up a tour. By the way there is a nice Holiday Inn in this same area.

reviews.title: chill out you're on vacation
reviews.text: My husband and I, as well as our friends, stayed at this hotel before our Princess cruise. We found this hotel to be very comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. The buffet breakfast and complimentary drinks in the evening were an added bonus. The hotel was a 2 block walk to the beach, which was beautiful and very safe to walk along. Taxis were always available to take to Old San Juan. The pool was great and very clean. The bed was one of the best we have ever slept on at a hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel, and we will definately stay here again.

reviews.title: nice hotel, conveniant location
reviews.text: We booked the suite online right before a major snowstorm hit . short ride from the air port.pool was very nice even though its by a highway it was fine.breakfast was good. evening mgrs reception they were very accomodating. room was fine. staff was very helpful. 2 blocks to beach and small shopping ctr to get some refreshments etc. we were there with 3 kids it was really a positive experience. beat the 12" of snow in ny that wkend before we boarded for a cruise(what a move that was)
Embassy Suites Hotel is an average hotel, with some nice features for the $$. I usually like to stay at more upscale resorts, but this was a last minute trip booked with friends.
reviews.title: What you'd expect from a 3-star hotel

reviews.title: Just got back from a week stay.

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights Saturday to Monday. Hotel was full of vacationers, and was quite noisy in the evening with partying and lots of small children on the loose. Location is good, one block from the local bus into Old San Juan, and 2 blocks to the beach and many shops and restaurants within walking distance. Room we had on the 7th floor set aside for Hilton Honors was on the small side and in need of some TLC; but it was adequate and functional. Breakfast was catering for a huge crowd, and they give Hilton Honors members a special line so you get served without much of a wait - that was a nice touch. They didnt offer the normal Hilton Honors free water bottles, but they did offer the free wi-fi. All in all, the stay was fine.
reviews.title: Hotel is ok

reviews.text: Big spacious suite with 2 double beds and a sofa bed for the 3 child worked well. They all loved the pool which was large and lots of fun. The breakfast was good but busy. lots of great food.
reviews.title: Excellent for a family

reviews.text: Happy hour was a great extra , kids helped themselves o dip and crisps and popcorn and we had drinks . We also ordered a large pizza from the adjoining takeaway and sat with our happy hour drinks having a pizza at the table which was nice. We stayed four days and the children really enjoyed and still talk about happy hour!
reviews.title: Way to End a Great Vacation . . .

reviews.text: There are lots of shops and eateries near bye -5 mins walk. Taxis to old San Juan are not expensive for a family as they are 7 seater or more. Old san Juan is lovely with lots to do and plenty good places to eat.
reviews.title: It was great!

description: The Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino is conveniently located just a short walk to the beautiful Isla Verde Beach. The hotel is also very close to the Luis Muñoz Marín Intl. airport. It is the only all-suite hotel in the San Juan metropolitan area. All our suites have a living room and a separate bedroom. Our guests enjoy a complimentary full cooked to order breakfast every morning and two hours of beverages every evening from 5:30 to 7:30pm. The Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino recreational facilities include a Casino, a lagoon style outdoor pool, kids playground, restaurants and a beach concession at Isla Verde Beach with beach towels, chairs and umbrellas for our guests. We offer over twelve thousand square feet of flexible meeting space including our La Vista Room which over-looks the free-form pool and waterfalls, ideal for social events.
